title: Rollandwon
author: Rollandwon
content: Greetings... A great question... Does any of you reading know someone who was on a World of Warcraft server that mined BTC... I'm talking about 2010/2011, I'm looking for people who have been on that server.Im The Mage Alumnomuerto from Scapegaming server.

comments.author: Mia Chloe
comments.body: Do you think those miners Will boldly step out to reveal their identity and put their privacy at risk? The Bitcoin network is mostly about anonymity and optimum privacy. so I see no reason why any person who knows a person that was into Bitcoin mining during early times of the likes of 2010 and 2011 should disclose such crucial info.Incase you don't know , block rewards at that time was massive compared to now therefore miners that still hodl from that period are theoretically whales and disclosing themselves puts them at great risk.Besides what are you looking to do with such information?

comments.author: Rollandwon
comments.body: Quote from: Mia Chloe on March 11, 2024, 02:04:29 AMDo you think those miners Will boldly step out to reveal their identity and put their privacy at risk? The Bitcoin network is mostly about anonymity and optimum privacy. so I see no reason why any person who knows a person that was into Bitcoin mining during early times of the likes of 2010 and 2011 should disclose such crucial info.Incase you don't know , block rewards at that time was massive compared to now therefore miners that still hodl from that period are theoretically whales and disclosing themselves puts them at great risk.Besides what are you looking to do with such information?Obviously I know all that friend.In my case I don't care about privacy, I just want let to know that I'm here.And yes... they were really quite juicy ðŸ‘½ðŸ’«Â  42 to 110 coin per day just Adnins and GM.

comments.author: ABCbits
comments.body: I never play WoW and didn't know about BTC on 2010/2011. But since you ask this question in this forum, i'd assume some discussion of your activity was done on here. In that case, you might want to use https://ninjastic.space/search to look for old post. Otherwise, you might want to ask your question on different Bitcoin or WoW community.
